intro: Cynoglossum velebiticum, commonly known as the Velebit bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It is a perennial herb that blooms from June to August, and its flowers attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
